Name: Cavatinen
Notes: The cavatina is a simpler and shorter form of song that was used increasingly during this period as an alternative to the extended Italian da capo-aria, which by then had become overblown. This first practical edition aims to replace the relatively inaccessible score of the cavatinas.
Long Description: The Cavatina is a simpler and shorter form of song that was used increasingly during the Baroque period as an alternative to the extended Italian da capo-aria, which by then had become overblown. This first practical edition aims to replace the relatively inaccessible score of the cavatinas.
Short Description: Cavatinen for voice, strings, and harpsichord by Wilhelmine von Bayreuth.
